results.title: Alexander the Great and the Hellenistic Age
results.brief_description: Alexander’s campaigns and the spread of Greek culture are the focuses of this film. The flowering of commerce, art and science that was the Hellenistic Age is reflected in the views of Rhodes and Delas, Hellenistic sculpture, the Temple of Zeus and the archaeological treasures of Sidon Sarcophagus, the Issis mosaic and the ruins of Persepolis.

results.title: Alexander Nevsky [study extract]
results.brief_description: One of a series of short extracts from feature films intended for study of cinema technique. During the 13th century, Russia was endangered by the invasion of Teutonic Knights, the founders of Prussia. Under the leadership of Prince Alexander Nevsky, the Russians unite and counter the German onslaught on the ice of Lake Peipus and defeat them. The commencement of the battle is the subject of the excerpt. At first Nevsky and his aides are seen on a high rock - the camera intercutting faces on the waiting soldiers and the preparation of the enemy camp. The Germans begin to advance, gathering speed. Battle is joined.

results.title: Alexander and the terrible, horrible, no good, very bad day (K)
results.brief_description: Anyone can have a bad day, but no one wants to have one quite as awful as seven year old Alexander’s. Whether it’s his mother forgetting to pack dessert in his lunch, or the dentist discovering he has a new cavity, nothing goes right for Alexander from sun-up to sun-down. Alexander will not only win children’s sympathy, he’ll remind the child in every adult how those little tragedies can accumulate to make an otherwise normal day seem like a catastrophe. Based on the best selling children’s book by Judith Viorst.

results.title: Alexander and the car with a missing headlight
results.creator_credit: Peter Fleischmann, Institut für Film und Bild, Weston Woods Studios and Cynthia Freitag
results.brief_description: Released by the Weston Woods Studios in 1966 and English language version directed by Cynthia Freitag. A fantasy about a small boy’s adventures as he drives around the world in an old car. Pictures, sound effects and narrative comments are by children of different nations. From the book by Peter Fleischmann and Morton Schindel. Suitable for lower primary level.

results.title: Alert!
results.brief_description: A series of incidents demonstrating the need for accident prevention. People on dangerous jobs are aware of the risks and keep their minds on their work, but passers-by and workers who are worried or inclined to day-dream, need to remember that nearly all accidents happen through thinking of something else. A quarter of all accidents happen through the job being done the wrong way; untidily, without safety devices or too fast. Film closes by re-emphasising the need to be constantly alert.

results.title: Alejandro Mamani: a case study in culture and personality
results.creator_credit: Ira R. Abrams, Harry Ratner, Holt, Rinehart and Winston and Coast Community College District
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Faces of culture”.
Alejandro Mamani is a leader in his Bolivian mountain community, but he is an old man and believes himself possessed of evil spirits. Many remedies are tried to rid him of these spirits, from traditional forms of exorcism to sleeping tablets, but all attempts fail and after making his will he eventually commits suicide. Did he go mad or did he simply make use of his culture to leave life, once he saw there was no further use for him and his affairs were in order? Narrated by David Carradine.

results.title: Alcoholism: who gets hurt?
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Questions, Answers.”.
Shows the problems of a son of an alcoholic as he vacillates between shielding his father and trying to find his own place among his peers. Uses an extract from the Disney production “Follow me boys” made in 1966.

group_siblings.title: Being right: can you still lose?
group_siblings.creator_credit: Walt Disney Educational Media Company

results.title: Alcoholism
results.brief_description: The film portrays alcoholism as a mental health problem and as an illness that can respond to treatment. Demonstrates that the causes of this illness are imbedded personality difficulties often relating back to the early formative years of the victim’s childhood. The film discusses different forms of alcoholism and the different treatment required for each type. The role of Alcoholics Anonymous is covered and a plea made for increased public facilities for the treatment of alcoholics.
